result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus W Walton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus W Walton in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Marcus W Walton.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a plea hearing. Case is now in trial posture. Defense requests to be scheduled on the trial calendar. Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marcus W Walton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court for Marcus W Walton.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Defendant is in custody at the HOC, appearance waived. Defense requests plea hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson in court, defendant Marcus W Walton not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is considering filing an Amended Information.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing 06-22-22 by JENNIFER CARTER.

Defendant Marcus W Walton in court by video with Attorney Scott Franklin Anderson who appears in person.  Defendant Marcus W Walton in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Citizen/victim C. Armstrong.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Marcus W Walton not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Reed informed the court that Scott Anderson is to appointed as counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus W Walton not in court, defendant in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court. 
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus W Walton not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cornelius L.A.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marcus W Walton in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Marcus W Walton in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marcus W Walton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
